articles.title: MeitY issues formal notice to X over Grok's  IT Act lapses
articles.summary: MeitY has issued a formal notice to X, citing serious lapses in statutory due diligence under the IT Act and Rules. The government is concerned about X's AI tool, Grok, generating and circulating obscene content, particularly targeting women and children. X has been directed to review Grok's framework, remove unlawful content, and take action against offending users within 72 hours.

articles.title: Grok user making illegal content will suffer same consequence as uploading such content: Musk
articles.summary: Microblogging platform X owner Elon Musk declared users of its AI service Grok generating illegal content will face severe penalties. This follows a directive from India's Ministry of Electronics and IT demanding immediate removal of vulgar and unlawful material.

articles.title: Niti Aayog drafts plan to shield senior citizens from digital scams
articles.summary: India is preparing a policy road map to protect senior citizens from digital scams, with Niti Aayog working on a multi-ministerial action plan. The plan will focus on digital literacy, stronger security and coordinated monitoring as cases of ‘digital arrest’ fraud rise. The move will form part of broader elderly care measures, with details likely in Budget 2026-27.

articles.title: Social media should take responsibility of content they publish: Union minister Vaishnaw
articles.summary: Social media companies must be accountable for the content they host, Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw has emphasised. The Indian government is pushing for stricter laws to ensure this. Online platforms have been warned of legal action if they fail to remove obscene and unlawful material. This includes content generated by AI apps.

articles.summary: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal’s defence of his company’s economic model collapses under its own contradictions.

articles.title: Jammu & Kashmir govt ropes in mosque imams to curb rising cases of heroin abuse
articles.summary: J&K government convened a workshop with over 100 mosque imams to combat rising heroin addiction. Religious leaders were urged to destigmatize patients and raise awareness about substance abuse's harmful impacts. This initiative is part of a three-stage strategy focusing on awareness, identification, and rehabilitation to address the growing drug menace in the region.

articles.title: EU carbon tax to hurt developing countries with extra costs: CSE
articles.summary: The Centre for Science and Environment (CSE) warns that the EU's new carbon border tax will shift decarbonisation costs onto developing nations like India. This measure, set to generate significant revenue for the EU, imposes tariffs on emission-intensive goods, potentially impacting India's steel and aluminium exports by around 25% and creating trade disadvantages.

articles.summary: The government has demanded that X undertake a comprehensive and immediate technical review of Grok including how it processes prompts and creation capabilities so as to not facilitate sexually explicit, unlawful content.

articles.title: MeitY takes cognisance of Grok misuse on X, action to follow soon: Secretary S Krishnan
articles.summary: The electronics and IT ministry has begun examining the alleged misuse of X’s AI tool Grok to generate obscene and non-consensual images, with MeitY Secretary S Krishnan indicating that regulatory action could be taken swiftly as scrutiny intensifies around platform accountability and AI safety.

articles.title: India's 'Reform Express' may have a difficult stretch ahead
articles.summary: India's government is pushing forward with ambitious reforms in 2025. While tax and financial changes are progressing, land acquisition and agricultural marketing reforms remain difficult. These crucial areas are key to India's manufacturing goals and rural economy. Addressing them will shape India's economic future. The government must navigate political sensitivities and economic realities to succeed.

articles.summary: The government is weighing a proposal to exempt investments up to 26% from the rigorous security screening process mandated by PN(3), provided the foreign entity exercises no management control and holds no seat on the company’s board, two people familiar with the matter said.

articles.summary: Section of faculty, students and alumni oppose MoSPI's draft Bill that seeks to replace Indian Statistical Institute's elected Governing Council with government-nominated board.

articles.summary: Computer-based tests, if used, should be conducted only in government-controlled centres, a Digvijay Singh-led Standing Committee has said in Parliament.

articles.title: Government announces Rs 7,295-cr export package to improve exporters' access to credit
articles.summary: The government has unveiled a Rs 7,295-crore export support package, including a Rs 5,181-crore interest subvention scheme and Rs 2,114-crore collateral support, to enhance exporters' access to credit. These initiatives, spanning 2025-31, aim to address trade finance challenges, offering subsidies and guarantees to eligible MSMEs, particularly for defence and SCOMET products.

articles.title: Centre seeks proposals from states for setting up of AI centres
articles.summary: MeitY is urging state governments to submit proposals for establishing AI centers of excellence to bolster India's leadership in the Global South. This initiative, part of the ₹10,371.92 crore IndiaAI Mission, aims to transform R&D and benefit startups by expanding computing infrastructure and fostering inclusive AI deployment.

articles.title: PM Modi reviews progress on overseas critical mineral acquisitions, ₹1,500-crore recycling incentive scheme
articles.summary: The review covered India’s efforts to secure long-term access to key minerals such as lithium, cobalt and rare earths, while scaling up domestic recycling capacity to reduce import dependence and support manufacturing under the Make in India programme.

articles.title: Saudi Finance Minister approves SR217 ($57.9) billion borrowing plan for 2026
articles.summary: Saudi Arabia has approved a SR217 billion borrowing plan for 2026 to meet its fiscal needs. The funds will cover an anticipated budget deficit of SR165 billion and repay around SR52 billion in maturing debt. The plan focuses on maintaining debt sustainability, diversifying funding sources through bonds, sukuk, and loans, and expanding alternative financing for projects and infrastructure.

articles.title: Stamp duty waived on farm loans up to Rs 2 lakh in Maharashtra
articles.summary: The revenue and forest department issued a government gazette notification in this regard on January 1. The waiver has come into effect from that date.

articles.title: Labour Codes may spur hiring as firms get more flexibility to restructure
articles.summary: The new Labour Codes are expected to boost hiring by giving firms greater flexibility to restructure operations. The Industrial Relations Code raises the threshold for government approval for layoffs and closures to 300 workers from 100, easing compliance for MSMEs and mid-sized firms. Experts say labour-intensive sectors will benefit most, though some warn of higher labour turnover and income volatility.

articles.title: ICICI Bank, SBI among 10 largecap bets by Antique Broking for 2026 as it eyes an earnings rebound
articles.summary: The brokerage sees India’s “Goldilocks” phase continuing, supported by policy actions, easing macro headwinds, and a revival in capital expenditure, while preferring financials, capex-linked sectors, defence, and select discretionary stocks.

articles.title: Why Deepak Shenoy remains cautious on tobacco, QSR valuations
articles.summary: Deepak Shenoy of Capitalmind MF outlines investment strategies amidst market shifts, advocating for conglomerate demergers and diversification for tobacco firms. He notes QSR valuations are stretched but sees potential in electronics manufacturing and power distribution, with PSU banks expected to lead financials and autos benefiting from policy support.

articles.title: Triple policy boosters set stage for a stronger market year ahead: Ajay Bagga
articles.summary: Indian markets are set for a robust year. Experts foresee renewed economic momentum fueled by government support. Expect double-digit nominal GDP growth translating to strong earnings. Financials are expected to lead the rally, with autos and technology also showing promise. Government spending on infrastructure, railways, and defence will be key drivers.

articles.title: India launches anti-dumping probe into nylon-6 chip imports from China, Russia
articles.summary: India has started an anti-dumping probe into nylon-6 chips from China and Russia, prompted by domestic manufacturers' concerns over cheap imports affecting local industry. The investigation will evaluate the implications for pricing and market stability in the synthetic raw materials sector.

articles.title: Why RBI’s liquidity play is reshaping bond market dynamics
articles.summary: India’s bond market is not fighting the RBI—it is adjusting to supply. With inflation contained, liquidity actively supported through OMOs, VRRs and swaps, and the central bank signalling readiness to step in when needed, the backdrop favours steady income generation.

articles.title: RBI continues to build forex reserves which rose to $696 billion
articles.summary: India’s forex reserves rose by $3.3 billion to $696.61 billion in the week ended December 26, RBI data showed. The increase was led by a sharp $2.95 billion jump in gold holdings and a modest rise in foreign currency assets. Reserves remain near record highs, providing cover for 9–10 months of imports amid global volatility.

articles.title: Centre designates core customs and indirect tax digital platforms as “critical information infrastructure” under IT Act
articles.summary: The Indian government has designated core customs and indirect tax digital platforms, including ICEGATE, ECCS, and ACES-GST, as "critical information infrastructure." This move significantly enhances cybersecurity controls and restricts access to authorized personnel only. Unauthorized access to these protected systems now carries criminal penalties under the Information Technology Act.

articles.title: BJP ally, Christian groups flag concern about violence against community during Christmas season
articles.summary: The National People’s Party said it will urge the Meghalaya government to write to the states concerned seeking action to prevent such attacks.

He is focusing on growth continuity and GARP opportunities, especially in potential turnaround sectors such as banks, lending, and parts of autos. He highlighted risks in high-valuation sectors, evolving consumption patterns in QSRs, and said inflation and policy cues will be key factors to track going ahead.

articles.title: India keeps small savings interest rates unchanged for seventh straight quarter

articles.summary: While Tharoor said law of jungle prevails today, Shiv Sena's Shaina NC slammed the US action saying no country can go around bullying the world.

articles.title: Sebi developing AI-driven tool to analyse cyber safety at entities

A dedicated working group will also focus on crafting a comprehensive technology roadmap for market infrastructure institutions, laying out a strategic vision for the next five and ten years.

articles.title: Govt proposes 90-day work requirement for gig workers to get social security
articles.summary: In a significant move, gig and platform workers will soon be required to log a minimum number of working days to qualify for social security benefits. Proposed regulations indicate a threshold of 90 days with a single aggregator or 120 days across various platforms each year. This initiative is designed to integrate workers into essential programs like Ayushman Bharat.

articles.title: Electronics production plugs into over Rs 41.5k crore investments

articles.title: FIIs dump Rs 7,608 cr in two sessions after 1.66 lakh cr sell-off in 2025. Why experts remain convinced on trend reversal in 2026?
articles.summary: Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) continued their selling spree into 2026, offloading Indian equities worth Rs 7,608 crore in the first two trading sessions. This follows record outflows of Rs 1.66 lakh crore in 2025, driven by elevated valuations and the AI trade. Experts anticipate a turnaround in 2026, with improved fundamentals and GDP growth expected to attract net FII inflows.

articles.title: FPIs withdraw  ₹7,608 crore from Indian equities in just 2 days of January — Here's what it signals
articles.summary: Foreign portfolio investors started 2026 by withdrawing ₹7,608 crore from Indian equities, continuing the selling trend from 2025. Despite this, experts believe improving domestic fundamentals may attract net foreign inflows later in the year as equity valuations stabilize.

This budget is crucial for India's economic growth and its goal to become a developed nation. The government is focusing on reforms and technology to boost competitiveness. India aims to strengthen its position as a global services powerhouse despite international challenges.

articles.title: India extends provisional anti-dumping duty on low-ash metallurgical coke imports from six countries till 30 June

articles.summary: Better-than-expected non-tax revenue collection of ₹5.16 trillion, or 88.6% of the full-year budget estimate, cushioned the central government's finances.

articles.title: RBI cautions against risks to economy even as fundamentals remain strong

articles.title: India imposes three-year safeguard duty on some steel products to curb cheap imports
articles.summary: The measure, which was published on the official government gazette, excludes imports from certain developing countries, though China, Vietnam, and Nepal will be subject to the levy. It also will not apply to specialty steel products such as stainless steel.

articles.title: India imposes three-year tariff on some steel products after ‘sudden, sharp’ increase in imports

articles.title: India is now fourth largest economy, says govt.
articles.summary: The government says that with the GDP valued at $4.18 trillion, “India has surpassed Japan to become the world’s fourth largest economy”, it says that the country is “poised to displace Germany from the third rank” with a projected GDP of $7.3 trillion by 2030

articles.title: Business events that shaped India in 2025
articles.summary: From Trump’s trade war to RBI repo rate cuts and major corporate entries, 2025 delivered several notable developments. Though not all were transformational, a few deserve closer attention.

articles.title: SPML Infra secures ₹159 crore surety bond limit, ₹22 crore arbitration award
articles.summary: In a separate development, the company secured an arbitration award of ₹21.61 crore from the Chennai Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (CMWSSB) on December 31, 2025. On Friday (January 2), shares of SPML Infra Ltd ended at ₹187.00, down by ₹3.29, or 1.73%, on the BSE.

articles.summary: The proposed policy shift marks a significant expansion of Delhi’s shared mobility framework, bringing private EV owners, cab aggregators, automakers and e-rickshaw operators into a single ecosystem. articles.title: India to push for consensus on global AI governance norms at AI Summit 2026: MeitY Secretary S Krishnan
articles.summary: With participation expected from over 100 countries, India is positioning the AI Summit 2026 as a major global platform to shape common frameworks on artificial intelligence, bringing together political leadership, policymakers and top technology executives to drive convergence on AI governance.

articles.title: Foreign fund outflows: FII began 2026 as sellers; over Rs 7,600 crore offloaded in 2 days

This caution follows a record Rs 1.66 lakh crore exit in 2025, driven by currency swings and global trade tensions. However, market participants anticipate a sentiment shift as domestic economic improvements and easing valuations could attract overseas capital back.

articles.title: Anticipate government to go for 10% capex growth in budget: L&T CFO

He highlighted the crucial role of infrastructure in India's developed economy goal and suggested a qualitative pricing mechanism for project bidding to ensure timely completion.

articles.title: Denial of limestone export data to Bangladesh justified; no larger public interest: CIC
articles.summary: The Central Information Commission has upheld the denial of exporter-wise details for limestone sold to Bangladesh. This information is protected under the commercial confidence clause. The commission stated that releasing such data could harm exporters' competitive positions. No overriding public interest was found to justify disclosure.

articles.title: Budget 2026: A top-up on tax reforms can shore up consumer confidence
articles.summary: India's economy thrives on domestic consumption, with upcoming Budget 2026 focusing on sustaining household purchasing power. GST 2.0 aims to boost disposable incomes and affordability through simplified rates and broader coverage. Reforms like bringing petroleum products and real estate under GST, alongside input tax credit and refund enhancements, are key to strengthening demand and fostering long-term growth.

articles.title: 8th Pay Commission: Who will get the most salary hike after January 1, 2026 — Junior or senior employees? Explained
articles.summary: 8th Pay Commission: Even though the in-hand salary of employees will receive only after the 8th Pay Commission announcement is made officially, the arrears will begin to accumulate from January. They will be released after the provisions of the 8th Pay Commission is announced.

articles.title: Eternal CEO Deepinder Goyal enters new arena of debate: Capitalism, class divide and gig economy
articles.summary: Amid backlash over gig worker strikes, Eternal CEO Deepinder Goyal sparked a wider debate by defending capitalism and the gig economy on social media. He argued that wealth must be created before it can be fairly shared, framing capitalism as the engine that drives value and growth. His remarks on class divide and labour drew strong reactions, winning support from some founders and investors while attracting criticism from workers’ advocates and politicians.

articles.summary: Chadha’s post on X followed Eternal CEO Deepinder Goyal’s statements defending the gig model by citing rising earnings and flexible work patterns. He emphasised that labour protections are necessary.

While export orders saw a dip, manufacturers anticipate future growth, though business sentiment has softened.

Venezuela's oil infrastructure remains operational, and its declining output represents a small fraction of global supplies. While rebuilding the sector is ambitious, current oversupply forecasts suggest market stability.
